page.title: 01The Bourne Valley
page.content:
The Bourne Valley dominates the {landscape}of this area. The River Bourne flows south through its v-shaped valley lined with orchards, hop gardens and fields containing a variety of arable crops.
The valley has been settled since the Bronze Age and there is evidence of Iron Age, Roman and Saxon settlement.
In recent years the{landscape}has changed a lot. Many orchards and hop gardens have given way to arable crops. Hedges have been grubbed out to make larger fields more suited to large machinery. Many oast houses remain, but few are now processing hops. Most have been converted into living accommodation.
